title: (cont to #824) uninstall mode of operation which doesn't deinit submodule
body:
as discussed in https://github.com/datalad/datalad/issues/824#issuecomment-247031174, the most obvious usecase -- I 'install ds' and 'uninstall ds' and come back to original state of things.  Such state of things is when `ds`, if it was a submodule, stays a submodule. ATM, it gets removed:

``` shell
$> datalad uninstall --remove-handles -r --remove-history -d labs
2016-09-20 08:26:19,453 [WARNING] cannot uninstall data only, not an annex dataset (uninstall.py:61)

2016-09-20 08:26:19,467 [WARNING] cannot uninstall data only, not an annex dataset (uninstall.py:61)
2016-09-20 08:26:19,476 [WARNING] removing subdataset <Dataset path=/tmp/datasets.datalad.org/labs/mitchell/science2008> from <Dataset path=/tmp/datasets.datalad.org/labs/mitchell> (uninstall.py:81)
```

note
- labs is deleted (so I would need to `reset --hard` it)
- those scary WARNINGs .  IMHO we shouldn't warn unless it might need (re)action on user's side. Here -- yes, it is not an annex, so what?  moreover "cannot uninstall data only?" -- I requested to uninstall everything necessary not just data (if it exists or not)
